definition: to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Funny way to get to a wizards' school, the train. Magic carpets all got punctures, have they?
sentences.chinese: 坐火車去魔法學院真有意思，難道飛毯都穿洞了嗎？

sentences.english: Holes are formed when aeroplanes pass through them, causing the air to expand.
sentences.chinese: 穿洞是飛機穿過時形成的，造成空氣膨脹。

sentences.english: Pierced ears, nose, navel, eye brows.
sentences.chinese: 穿洞的耳朵，鼻子，肚臍，眉毛。

sentences.english: This is the most distinctive piercing Zunyi.
sentences.chinese: 這是遵義最有特徵地穿洞。

sentences.english: This mechanism is thought to be what creates hole-punch clouds.
sentences.chinese: 該原理被視作“穿洞雲”的成因。

sentences.english: Laceration of the posterior tracheal wall is 1 of the risks of transhiatal esophagectomy (THE).
sentences.chinese: 穿洞式食道切除的危險率是氣管後壁的撕裂。

sentences.english: The cloud's round shape is likely what is known as a hole-punch cloud.
sentences.chinese: 雲的圓形很可能就是人們所稱的穿洞雲。

sentences.english: It leaves only small marks where holes were made in the skin.
sentences.chinese: 這種手術只會在穿洞的皮膚上留下很小的疤痕。

definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
sheer cliffs and precipitous rock faces (idiom)
to punch a hole/to drill a hole/to dig a hole/to burrow
